verb.description: (of a line, arc, or figure) form (an angle) at a particular point when straight lines from its extremities are joined at that point.
examples: the angle subtended by a string of length r at the center of the sphere

verb.description: (of a bract) extend under (a flower) so as to support or enfold it.
examples: the main beauty is provided by the bracts which subtend the flowers

origin: Late 16th century (in subtend (sense 1)): from Latin subtendere, from sub- under + tendere stretch. subtend (sense 2) dates from the late 19th century.
